gov.nasa.jpf.util

Class DynamicObjectArray<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.nasa.jpf.util.DynamicObjectArray<E>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterable<E>

    public final class DynamicObjectArray<E>
extends Object
implements Iterable<E>
    simplistic Object array that differentiates from ArrayList by using chunks instead of exponential growth, thus efficiently dealing with huge, potentially sparse arrays the motivation for this class is memory optimization, i.e. space efficient storage of potentially huge arrays without good a-priori size guesses this class is awfully lifted from DynamicIntArray (same motivation, but primitive types - not much factorizable functionality w/o excessive casting/boxing) the API of this class is between a primitive array and a AbstractList. Since it handles Objects, we could turn this into a Collection (and probably should) NOTE: like standard Collection implementations/arrays, this class is not synchronized

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DynamicObjectArray() 
      DynamicObjectArray(Growth strategy, int chunkBits, int initChunks) 
      DynamicObjectArray(int chunkBits, int initChunks)
      Creates a DynamicObjectArray in which each chunk has 2**chunkBits elements and initChunks chunks are initially allocated.
